intro: Rhipidocladum neumannii, commonly known as the Neumann's rock cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, mat-forming perennial plant characterized by its dense, low-growing structure. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Rhipidocladum neumannii is adapted to survive in harsh environments, often thriving in full sun and with minimal water requirements.
